Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Cancrin (Natural AMPs, Leu-rich, frog, amphibians, marine animals, XXA, UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (34.78%) toLividin 8 HLmbV=G=P=Y=Q=K: 11%. GRAVY: -1.0; mol Wt: 2187.437; mol formula: C101H149N26O28; mol ex coeff: 8530. This is a unique sequence differing from all other amphibian peptides in the APD.Activity: active against E.coli ATCC25922 (MIC >100 ug/ml), B. dysenteriae (MIC 60 ug/ml), S. aureus ATCC2592 (MIC 15 ug/ml), and C. albicans ATCC2002 (MIC 30 ug/ml).In vitro toxicity: rabbit RBC: little hemolysis up to 100 ug/ml.
Literature Information.Author: Lu Y, Ma Y, Wang X, Liang J, Zhang C, Zhang K, Lin G, Lai R. 2008
Literature Information.Title: The first antimicrobial peptide from sea amphibian.
